intro: Gomphia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved gomphia, is a unique member of the Restionaceae family, native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form and fibrous, wiry stems. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with tiny, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and densely packed, often covered in fine hairs. Gomphia microphylla is adapted to nutrient-poor, sandy soils and is typically found in fynbos vegetation, showcasing its ecological significance in its native habitat.
